text: New Zealand Clerical Workers' Union began in 1936 as Wellington Clerical Workers' Union.The Evening Post, 30 April 1936 Page 10 It negotiated the first general clerical workers award in 1936.The Evening Post, 25 September 1936 Page 10The Evening Post, 1 October 1936 Page 10 Wellington amalgamated with other regional unions and finally formed New Zealand Clerical Workers Union.New Zealand Clerical Workers Union : Records, Alexander Turnbull Library, National Library of New Zealand The union was obliged to cease operating by the passing of the Employment Contracts Act 1991. ==References== Category:Trade unions in New Zealand Category:New Zealand labour law Category:Trade unions established in 1936 Category:Trade unions disestablished in 1991
title: New Zealand Clerical Workers Union
